messageBody:
On Sun, 2 Feb 2003, Scott Stirling wrote:

> Why not just extend TestCase with specialized, re-usable, TestCase types?

I do already. In fact, many times: we have a base test case for our
company which adds various handy generic stuff (such as byte-array
comparisons), inheriting from that often a test case for a project
adding some project specific-stuff, inheriting from that in certain
packages a package-specific test case adding stuff for the servlet or
DB testing or whatever, and so on.

Unfortunately, it's not very modular; if someone supplies me with
a ExtendedTestCaseOne and another person supplies me with an
ExtendedTestCaseTwo, each of which has certain features I want, I can't
inherit from both. And again, the test cases tend to collect more and
more code, becoming this massive objects with massive functionality (and
correspondingly massive tests)....

My primary feeling here (whether supportable or not) is that a TestCase
could be a lot smaller and simpler if we could move most of the
assertion checking and assertion message generation code out of it.
As well it would also give us the ability to easily add different
ways of asserting where and when we need them, without having to use
inheritance to bring in new implemenations of something. (I'm a big fan
of type inheritance; I'm rather dubious about the use of inheritance for
implemenation purposes only.)
